scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of your team members, Sarah, says, 'I don't think we can make it in time. This is too much!' You responded, 'I know it's tough, but let's break it down into smaller tasks and tackle them one by one. We'll get through this together.' Monica and Bob are also present during the discussion. Monica nods in agreement but looks worried. Bob, on the other hand, crosses his arms and seems skeptical. Monica then says, 'I feel like we’re all just going through the motions. It's hard to stay motivated.' You suggested, 'I understand, Monica. Let's have a quick break and share any ideas that might make this project more engaging for everyone.' The team takes a short break, and after returning, Bob still seems unconvinced. Bob then says, 'Even with a break, I don't see how we can pull this off. The deadline is just too tight.' You responded, 'We’ve tackled tight deadlines before. Let’s not get bogged down by doubts and keep pushing forward.' Monica seems to be feeling somewhat better, but Bob is still restless, pacing around the room. Monica sighs and says, 'I'm trying to stay positive, but the stress is really getting to me.' Bob adds, 'And it doesn't help that we don't even have all the resources we need.' You replied, 'I know it’s tough, but we’ve faced similar pressures before and come through. Let’s try to keep our heads up and push forward.' Now, Monica is fidgeting with her pen, while Bob sits down and leans back in his chair, clearly frustrated.
scenes.description: Bob mutters, 'This is hopeless. Even if we push forward, we can't win against an impossible deadline.'

options.text: Bob, I understand it feels daunting. Let's focus on what we can achieve and take it step by step.
options.analysis: You acknowledged Bob's feelings and suggested a practical approach, showing good emotional perception and communication skills.

options.text: I get that it seems tough, but complaining won't help. Let's put our heads down and get to work.
options.analysis: You emphasized the need for action over complaints, showing good emotional regulation, though interpersonal balance could be improved.

options.text: We can only do our best with what we have. If anyone has better ideas, now’s the time to share them.
options.analysis: You opened the floor for suggestions, displaying good interpersonal balance and communication skills.
